intro: Systellantha, commonly known as the false bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to southern Africa. The plants typically have erect or spreading stems and produce showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of blue, purple, or white. Systellantha species are often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
